title: How to Create a Nested List in HTML

steps.title: Learn how to make a list in HTML.
steps.content: Learn how to make a list in HTML .

steps.title: Learn that a nested list is just an outline of a list with indentations and other lists inside a big list.
steps.content: Learn that a nested list is just an outline of a list with indentations and other lists inside a big list.

steps.title: Create the first part of the list up to the point where you'd like the indentation nested list to be placed/begin and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Create the first part of the list up to the point where you'd like the indentation nested list to be placed/begin and press ↵ Enter . Don't clear the initial list with a or tag yet. Also, don't denote a separate list item, if it has no label to go along with it. Sometimes, looking at the code, you can see that this new list is a nested list.

steps.title: Create the new indented sub-list using the format for the type of list you'd like.
steps.content: Create the new indented sub-list using the format for the type of list you'd like. Denote the list using either the <ul> or <ol> tag and enter your list items.

steps.title: End the full outer list or, if you have further indentations, type these lists too (while not ending the previous lists).
steps.content: End the full outer list or, if you have further indentations, type these lists too (while not ending the previous lists). If you need to bring more bullet points outwards a level after you are finished, end the list and type another list item without typing a brand new ordered list or unordered list-tag.

steps.title: Bring the document to a close.
steps.content: Bring the document to a close. Type the ending tag for the ordered tag or unordered tag (in a reverse fashion, from inner-most to outer-most fashion).
